review: As I am moving in the direction of eliminating my ridiculously expensive DirecTV I wanted something to supplement my network programming I am now receiving by an HDTV antenna. As an Amazon Prime user, the Firestick is a great supplement. It was great to see the series Vikings available and with the Firestick I have been able to start catching up on previous season...very nice.
author: Bernie Johnson

author: Brian

review: I was pretty excited to get my Fire TV Stick and the interface and range of content is extensive it's responsiveness and "zippiness" is truly lacking.I previously used my Xbox as my streaming device, also set up wirelessly and had no issue with connection or reliability but I no longer game and the box and interface of the Xbox software in conjunction with a game controller was far too clunky for me. With that in mind I eventually turned to Fire TV based of extensive research, my personal needs and customer reviews. As it turns out Fire TV stick just does not match up. HBO GO is particularly frustrating. Yes Amazon Prime works just fine but honestly it's content is the least impressive and as such least used.I wouldn't say the Fire TV stick was a poor investment but I certainly wish I would have tried the Fire TV box streamer first as the Stick just doesn't hold up to the speed and consistency of my Xbox. I hope a software update or a newer version will alleviate my issues.
author: Sylvester Greenwell
